main event: On October 26, 1961, ground radar tracked an unidentified object in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, reported to be very bright and bluish-white in color.
interesting points: The object moved, slowed, and stopped at times. It vanished from the radar screen at times. Multiple witnesses confirmed the sighting, which lasted about 5 minutes. The object exhibited characteristics of an unidentified aerial phenomenon, leading to notifications made to the Ground Observer Corps and Air Force. The witness speculated it could be a satellite or its exhaust.
sighted object: A very bright, bluish-white unidentified object
witness description: Retired city fireman, little knowledge of the subject except for sightings over the years.
